content: Title IX prohibits sex-based discrimination in education programs receiving federal financial assistance, but it has exceptions. One exception is that Title IX only applies to certain types of institutions for admissions, excluding nonvocational elementary or secondary schools and some undergraduate higher education institutions. This allows for public or private single-sex elementary and secondary schools.
